intro: Isodon rosthornii, commonly known as the mountain betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern and eastern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of blue or purple. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its roots are known for their medicinal properties. Isodon rosthornii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
